channel.title: Transformer Circuits (Unofficial)
channel.description: Unofficial RSS feed generated from the homepage of transformer-circuits.pub

item.title: Garcon
item.description: A description of our tooling for doing interpretability on large models.

item.title: PySvelte
item.description: One approach to bridging Python and web-based interactive diagrams for interpretability research.

item.title: Videos
item.description: Very rough informal talks as we search for a way to reverse engineering transformers.

item.title: Exercises
item.description: Some exercises we've developed to improve our understanding of how neural networks implement algorithms at the parameter level.

item.title: Mechanistic Interpretability, Variables, and the Importance of Interpretable Bases
item.description: An informal note on intuitions related to mechanistic interpretability.

item.title: Softmax Linear Units
item.description: An alternative activation function increases the fraction of neurons which appear to correspond to human-understandable concepts.

item.title: Privileged Bases in the Transformer Residual Stream
item.description: Our mathematical theories of the Transformer architecture suggest that individual coordinates in the residual stream should have no special significance, but recent work has shown that this observation is false in practice. We investigate this phenomenon and provisionally conclude that the per-dimension normalizers in the Adam optimizer are to blame for the effect.

item.title: Distributed Representations: Composition & Superposition
item.description: An informal note on how "distributed representations" might be understood as two different, competing strategies â "composition" and "superposition" â with quite different properties.

item.title: Interpretability Dreams
item.description: Our present research aims to create a foundation for mechanistic interpretability research. In doing so, it's important to keep sight of what we're trying to lay the foundations for.

item.title: Circuits Updates â May 2023
item.description: A collection of small updates from the Anthropic Interpretability Team.

item.title: Circuits Updates â July 2023
item.description: A collection of small updates from the Anthropic Interpretability Team.

item.title: Circuits Updates â January 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates from the Anthropic Interpretability Team.

item.title: Circuits Updates â February 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates from the Anthropic Interpretability Team.

item.title: Reflections on Qualitative Research
item.description: Some opinionated thoughts on why interpretability research may have qualitative aspects be more central than we're used to in other fields.

item.title: Circuits Updates â March 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates from the Anthropic Interpretability Team.

item.title: Circuits Updates â April 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates from the Anthropic Interpretability Team.

item.title: Circuits Updates â June 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates: topk and gated SAE investigation.

item.title: Circuits Updates â July 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates: five hurdles, linear representations, dark matter, pivot tables, feature sensitivity.

item.title: Circuits Updates â August 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates: interpretability evals, reproducing self-explanation.

item.title: Circuits Updates â September 2024
item.description: A collection of small updates: investigating successor heads, oversampling data in SAEs.

item.title: Using Dictionary Learning Features as Classifiers
item.description: A preliminary note comparing feature-based and raw-activation based harmfulness classifiers.

item.title: Sparse Crosscoders for Cross-Layer Features and Model Diffing
item.description: A preliminary note on a way to get consistent features across layers, and even models.

item.title: Stage-Wise Model Diffing
item.description: A preliminary note on model diffing through dictionary fine-tuning.

item.title: Circuits Updates â January 2025
item.description: A collection of small updates: dictionary learning optimization techniques.

item.title: Insights on Crosscoder Model Diffing
item.description: A preliminary note on using crosscoders to diff models.

item.title: Progress on Attention
item.description: An update on our progress studying attention.

item.title: Circuits Updates â April 2025
item.description: A collection of small updates: jailbreaks, dense features, and spinning up on interpretability.

item.title: Automated Auditing
item.description: A note on using agents to perform automated alignment audits, including using interpretability tools.

item.title: Circuits Updates â July 2025
item.description: A collection of small updates: revisiting A Mathematical Framework and applications of interpretability to biology.

item.title: Sparse mixtures of linear transforms
item.description: We investigate sparse mixture of linear transforms (MOLT), a new approach to transcoders.

item.title: A Toy Model of Interference Weights
item.description: Unpacking "interference weights" in some more depth.

item.title: A Toy Model of Mechanistic (Un)Faithfulness
item.description: When transcoders go awry.

item.title: Circuits Updates â August 2025
item.description: A small update: How does a persona modify the assistantâs response?

item.title: Circuits Updates â September 2025
item.description: A small update on features and in-context learning.
